page.title: 15Changes in Rawmarsh 1960-85
page.content: Rawmarsh has seen many changes since 1960. On the site of{St.Mary's}school were a dance hall and old cottages and where{Green Lane}police station stands there used to be a row of old houses and an alchemist's shop. The{Manor Farm}estate is on the site of the original Manor Farm and {Monkwood Estate}is situated on the old Bluebell Wood. An old sweet shop and chapel stood where{Green Rise}is today and{Stubbin {Close,}one of the newest streets, used to be the road to Stubbin Colliery and a farm. The slag-heaps were turned into a field for the{Comprehensive {School}which also has new 'ROSLA', sports and craft blocks. Nearing completion is the estate of {Rosehill Gardens}built on the grounds of the old Rosehill Hospital.
